comment: He takes lots of points off for random things, but if you ask him the grading criteria for each report while doing the lab, it's easier to get good grades

I feel like Dr. Guzzi isn't getting a fair critique. His grading is clear cut and fair (sometimes generous). I've had him for multiple classes and he can seem a little rigid at first glance, but there's a reason. He desperately wants to set you up for success. He is very willing to sit down with you an walk you through tough material. He's solid.

Guzzi is a very smart and reserved professor. This class however has a lot of prereqs that aren't listed that are crucial, but he helps to fill in those spots. If you show up to class and do the homework, you will have a great time in class, as the topics are very interesting. He inspired me to get more into physics (I'm an ME major).

I feel like some of the ratings here are a little harsh. I think he is pretty decent professor. He makes sure you know what the standards are, and makes time for those that are having trouble in lecture. The tests are a little different from the work done in class or on the homework, but they are similar. He genuinely cares about you performance.

just know if you ask a question in his class be ready to be shot down with a response how its your fault for not preparing yourself. He can treat you like a bro if you have intellectual engineering conversations. He is very knowledgeable. I feel like his class is suited for those who do electrical stuff as a hobby.
